audio_caption: The clip opens with a male speaker in a friendly tone introducing a FIFA 22 mod and its features, contrasting it with an upcoming full version. He then notes the simplicity of the mod.

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the features of a mod, mentioning it includes licenses for several Italian football teams and fixes issues with youth player models. He directs the listener to a website to download the "light" version of the mod, warning that the "light" option might be replaced by a "full" version in the future, and advising the listener to check the speaker's channel for an updated video. He then explains the installation process, including the mod's features like real kits, banners, and logos, and gives credit to the contributors. He details how to select either the MediaFire or Mega link, noting that the file is under 100 megabytes. He finishes by instructing the listener to click download and stating that the download process is about it.

The audio begins with a male speaker giving instructions. He first explains that one should wait until a download completes, and that programs like "WinRAR" and "7-Zip" can open "RAR" files. He suggests visiting "rarlab.com" to download a program if needed. Next, he notes that the file has downloaded, and one should extract it somewhere on their computer, not extracting individual mods, but the whole folder. He continues, saying that after extraction, two files will be visible, one of which is the "mod file" that adds content, like "the kits, the crests, the names, the banners, whatever." He mentions needing FIFA Mod Manager to install it and refers to a tutorial for it, available on "FIFAeditor.tool.com." If there is uncertainty about any of that, he encourages listeners to go watch the tutorial.

The clip begins with speech from a male speaker, who casually describes how to open a "mod manager," instructing the listener to "select FIFA 22." He reassures viewers to "go watch the tutorial" if they're stuck. The same speaker then says the "mod manager will open up here." He mentions having already installed something but assures listeners that he'll show them how to do it.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing how to install mods by dragging or importing them, explaining the process of applying them and prioritizing the "reels mod." He highlights options like double-clicking or using the "apply mods" function, suggesting the user place it at the bottom of the list. He mentions a description section and concludes by advising the listener to click "launch" and use DirectX 11.

The clip begins with a male speaker noting that the FIFA 22 version of the mod manager is faster, suggesting it should launch quickly. He adds that if it takes a while, waiting is advised, and the Real's mod Discord is recommended for any issues. He reiterates that the mod only contains licenses and two fixes. Then, he mentions the FIFA has launched and we can make sure the mod has applied.

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing installing a squad file, referencing a previous tutorial for a prior version of a game. He explains that while the squad file isn't required, it is heavily recommended to update kit and team settings for licensed teams. He details where to locate the squad file and how to copy it for safekeeping. The speaker instructs listeners to go into the game, select a profile, load the squad, and choose the file. During the description of the file path, brief music plays in the background.

The clip begins with a male speaker noting some aspects and licenses of a video game. He mentions licensed entities, kits, and the ability to edit players. He recommends joining a Discord for help and following his social media for news. He encourages listeners to sign up for Patreon for rewards. He mentions upcoming releases and plans, hoping the light mod suffices until the full version. He closes by teasing more news about the full mod and signs off. A short, upbeat music clip with drums and synths, creates a light and encouraging tone, while serving as background music throughout the speaker's presentation.

The clip starts with a male speaker promoting a Discord server, urging listeners to join and mentioning its features, such as feedback channels for player faces and gameplay. The speaker sounds casual and enthusiastic. Then, a hip-hop or rap song begins, conveying a reflective mood with a slightly melancholic tone. The main instruments in the song are synth and drums, and a male vocalist sings about feeling like time is running out and trying to make things right.
